subtitleNullable: The street-level image goldmine with 25K crowdsourced scenes, used by Meta SAM
descriptionNullable:
It is a large, diverse dataset of street-level images labelled for semantic segmentation and object detection.
Contains **25,000** high-resolution images collected from various street-level scenes around the world.

- The images are annotated with **66 object classes** for semantic segmentation, like road, sidewalk, building, traffic sign, person, car, etc.
- There are also bounding box annotations for 37 of those classes for object detection.
- The dataset has a variety of scenes, including city, town, village, countryside, beach, and winter images. Captured across 6 continents.
- Provides both train and validation splits. Train has 18,000 images, and validation has 2,000 images.
- Can be used to train models for tasks like semantic segmentation, instance segmentation, and object detection for self-driving cars, mobility applications, geographical analysis, etc.
- Models pretrained on Mapillary Vistas transfer well to other street-level or aerial image datasets.

Overall, Mapillary Vistas is a high quality, diverse dataset useful for various urban computer vision tasks involving classifying and localizing objects in street-level scenes. The varied images and multi-label annotations enable training rich perception models.
The Mapillary Vistas dataset was used to train **Meta's SAM** model for panoptic segmentation. SAM achieved state-of-the-art results on this dataset in 2021. Mapillary Vistas provides a diverse set of street-level scenes that enabled Meta to train a single model capable of segmenting many different classes.


[Source](https://www.mapillary.com/dataset/vistas)
